text: Paderborn () is a Kreis (district) in the east of North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. == History == Paderborn became a part of Prussia in 1802. After the Napoleonic wars when Prussia created the province Westphalia it split Paderborn into two districts - Paderborn and Büren. In 1975 these two districts were joined together again to make the current Paderborn district. == Coat of arms == The red cross in the top of the coat of arms symbolizes the clerical state Paderborn. The wavy line below stands for the rivers in the district, especially the Lippe River. The symbol in bottom is from the Lords of Büren. ==Towns and municipalities== Cities Cities Municipalities # Bad Lippspringe # Bad Wünnenberg # Büren # Delbrück 5. Lichtenau 6. Paderborn 7. Salzkotten # Altenbeken # Borchen # Hövelhof ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website (German)
title: Paderborn (district)
